Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/String/replaceAll
Function str replaceAll(str subject, str find, str replacement)
Description Return a copy of subject in which all occurrences of find (if any) have been replaced by replacement. Also see replaceFirst and replaceLast.
Examples 
rascal>import String;
ok
rascal>replaceAll("abracadabra", "a", "A");
str: "AbrAcAdAbrA"
rascal>replaceAll("abracadabra", "ra", "RARA");
str: "abRARAcadabRARA"
rascal>replaceAll("abracadabra", "cra", "CRA");
str: "abracadabra"
Pitfalls Note that find is a string (as opposed to, for instance, a regular expression in Java).
[Edit] | [New Subconcept] | [Recompile Course] | [Warnings]
